Plot Network Graph To Show VDJ Gene Relationships

Source: R/plot_vdj.R
PlotVDJByNetwork.Rd

PlotVDJByNetwork Plots the weighted relationship between VDJ genes across the cell sample. Plot is either a Sankey diagram or Chord diagram

PlotVDJByNetwork(
  edges,
  nodes,
  connections,
  type = "sankey",
  segment,
  pair = "VJ",
  palette = "bold",
  bg.color = "light"
)

Arguments

edges

Edge list, created from BuildVDJNetwork
nodes

Node list, created from BuildVDJNetwork
connections

Connections list, created from BuildVDJNetwork
type

Type of plot. Either "sankey" or "chord"
segment

VDJ gene for chain of immune cell receptor (i.e. "TRAV9")
pair

Pair of VDJ relationships. Ex.) 'VD' or 'VJ', or 'DJ'
palette

Any ggsci, color brewer, or palettes available from PullPalettes
bg.color

Helpful param for applying a global light or dark theme in a scheme, such as global theme for Shiny apps. "light" or "dark".

Value

PlotVDJByNetwork returns a sankey diagram or chord diagram depending on type param

See also

BuildVDJNetwork

Examples

gene_network <- BuildVDJNetwork(data=pbmc_vdj[[]], chain="TRB")
#> Error in BuildVDJNetwork(data = pbmc_vdj[[]], chain = "TRB"): unused argument (chain = "TRB")
edges <- gene_network[[1]]
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'gene_network' not found
nodes <- gene_network[[2]]
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'gene_network' not found
connections <- gene_network[[3]]
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'gene_network' not found
sankey <- PlotVDJByNetwork(edges, nodes, connections,type="sankey")
#> Error in dplyr::mutate(nodes, id = id - 1): object 'nodes' not found
sankey
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'sankey' not found
